name: monomorphemic

having one morpheme (= the smallest unit of language that has its own meaning, either a word or a part of a word): The words were marked for whether they were monomorphemic (eg "sock") or bimorphemic (eg "boys"). Related word

More examplesFewer examplesIn Chinese, there are monomorphemic words that contain two characters.The study was interested in children's production of monomorphemic words.The prediction is that there will be a big difference between rates of deletion in regular past tense versus monomorphemic forms.
